Description: Neck and shoulder sherd of North Ionian black-figured pottery closed vessel, oinochoe or amphora; brownish cream slip; exterior, from top: neck glazed; tongues, some red, at top of shoulder; animal frieze on shoulder between bands with superimposed added red band lined in white; in frieze black-figure decoration consisting of lion (only part of tail missing) to left; at left, possibly part of an outspread wing; incised spinter rosettes and dots as filling ornament; trace of frieze on body.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.953)
